status.description: NEW, PRESALES, POSTSALES, PROVISIONING, ACTIVATION, CANCELED, COMPLETED, WAITING_ON_EXTERNAL_ACTION

configActivationType.description: Base, Current, Backup, Planned, Test, Template

deviceConfigMethod.description: 0 - not configured, 1 - using the CONSOLE port, 2 - using the AUXILIARY port, 3 - using a virtual terminal interface, 4 - download through a TFTP server, 5 - download through an FTP server, 6 - download through a NMS

0 - not configured, 1 - using the CONSOLE port, 2 - using the AUXILIARY port, 3 - using a virtual terminal interface, 4 - download through a TFTP server, 5 - download through an FTP server, 6 - download through a NMS

typeOfPort.description: 0: Unknown, 1: Ethernet, 2: FastEthernet, 3: Auto-Sensing, 4: GigabitEthernet, 5: FastGigabitEthernet, 6: DS-0, 7: DS-1, 8: DS-3, 9: T1, 10: T3, 11: E1, 12: E3, 13: OC-3, 14: OC-12, 15: OC-48, 16: OC-192, 17: RS-232C

direction.description: 0: Unknown, 1: Sources Traffic, 2: Sinks Traffic, 3: Carries Traffic Bi-directionally

typeOfTP.description: 0: unknown, 1: uni-directional, source, 2: uni-directional, sink, 3: bi-directional, source, 4: bi-directional, sink

sideType.description: Legal values::  0 - unknown, 1 - ProviderEdge, 2 - CustomerEdge, 3 - ProviderCore, 9 - Other

startMode.description: 0: Unknown, 1: Automatically by the managed environment, 2:  Automatically by the owning device, 3:  Manually by the Provider of the Service, 4:  Manually by a Customer of the Provider, 5:  Any of the above

configActivationType.description: Base, Current, Backup, Planned, Test, Template

vlanTagging.description: Defines how 802.1q VLAN Tags are handled at the UNI. Legal values are: 0 - unknown / undefined, 1 - VLAN Tags are prohibited at the UNI, 2 - VLAN Tags are mapped at the UNI (see the VLANtoEVCMap), 3 - VLAN Tags are preserved at the UNI via Q-in-Q VLAN Tag Stacking, 4 - VLAN Tags are preserved at the UNI via MAC-in-MAC Header Stacking

cmStatus.description: 1 - other than below, 2 - ranging, 3 - ranging aborted, 4 - ranging complete, 5 - IP complete (IP Address DHCP-assigned), 6 - registration complete (aka operational), 7 - access denied, 8 - RESERVED, 9 - registered, BPI initialized

slotPurpose.description: 0: Unknown, 1: System, 2: Networking, 3: Port Adapter, 4: Memory, 5: Hardware Assist, 6: Video, 7: General Computing, 8: General Purpose

startMode.description: 0:  Unknown, 1:  Automatically by the managed environment, 2:  Automatically by the owning device, 3:  Manually by the Provider of the Service, 4:  Manually by a Customer of the Provider, 5:  Any of the above
